definition: to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: Learn how to escape a single wrist grab in this free video on kid's self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 了解如何摆脱在这个免费视频单手腕孩子的自卫抢。

sentences.english: This was the epoch when a National Guardsman fought like a Zouave.
sentences.chinese: 在那个时代国民自卫军打起仗来就象轻步兵一样。

sentences.english: In the course of this struggle we must arm the people, i. e. , organize self-defence corps and guerrilla units.
sentences.chinese: 要从这种斗争中去武装人民，即组织自卫军和游击队。

sentences.english: The spitting is used only in defense and never to get food.
sentences.chinese: 吐射毒液只用于自卫，从不用于捕食。

sentences.english: the offensive offender defended himself with the fence.
sentences.chinese: 那个厌恶的触犯者用竹篱自卫。

sentences.english: He told police that he had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 他对警方说他的行为是出于自卫。

sentences.english: You can also use it in self-defense.
Iran should not underestimate our resolve for self-defense, " said Peres.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗也不应当低估我们自卫的决心。

sentences.english: Ginder said. Make sure your tone of voice is not defensive.
Scrambling for self-protection and abandoning the rest of the group.
sentences.chinese: 出于自卫的竞争并且禁止团队休息。

sentences.english: That is the key word, self-defense.
He shot the man in self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 他是为了自卫才向那人开枪的。

sentences.english: He plead that he have act in self-defence when he have hit the mugger .
sentences.chinese: 他抗辩道，当他打击行凶抢劫者时他是在自卫。
河马只有在自卫时才会杀人。

sentences.english: The regular Army was supported by the Territorial Force, and by reservists.
sentences.chinese: 常备军由地方自卫队和后备军支持。

sentences.english: The National Guardsmen and the soldiers laughed as they took aim at him.
sentences.chinese: 那些国民自卫军和士兵一面对他瞄准一面笑。
